definition: Good has its reward and evil has its recompense. The payback is just a matter of time
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4 , ruo4 ran2 bu4 bao4 shi2 chen2 wei4 dao4
containing_words.word: 善有善報，惡有惡報，若然不報時晨未到

sentences.english: I read newspaper, is wearing a Presbyopia mirror.
sentences.chinese: 我看書報時，是戴了老花眼鏡。

sentences.english: I didn't hear the clock strike.
Still, I'm glad the bell is working again.
sentences.chinese: 不過，鍾又能報時了，我很高興。

sentences.english: The strikes of the clock woke me up.
sentences.chinese: 時鐘報時的聲音使我醒來。

sentences.english: We waited for the clock to strike.
Clock tell the time and trains take you places.
sentences.chinese: 鍾要報時，火車要帶你去往目的地。

sentences.english: The clock is timed to the moment.
We can tell the time by a clock.
This alarm mechanism fit for kinds of ordinary mechanical pendulum clock movements.
sentences.chinese: 這種報時裝置適合於各種普通機械擺鐘機心。

sentences.english: The notification for registration must state the extent of the power of representation of the liquidators.
sentences.chinese: 申報時，必須說明清算人的代表權。

sentences.english: Clocks tell the time and trains take you places.
sentences.chinese: 鍾要報時，火車要帶你去往目的地。

sentences.english: Awake, O bell! proclaim the hour.
The clock raised its voice now and then, but her husband did not return.
sentences.chinese: 時鐘一次又一次鳴奏着報時，但她丈夫仍未回來。

sentences.english: This is the whole point of a small-time program, it is the value of learning.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個整點報時的小程序，很有學習價值的。

sentences.english: One night, however, our vicar woke up with a start: the clock was striking the hours! .
sentences.chinese: 但是有一晚牧師卻被驚醒了，因爲鍾又在報時了。

sentences.english: The little clock tinkled out the hours.
sentences.chinese: 那隻小鐘丁當丁當地報時。

definition: to measure time/to time/to reckon by time
pointer on a gauge/clock hand/cursor/(computing) pointer
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to exceed the time limit/(to work) overtime/(computing) timeout
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
